Culinary Profile & Uses

1. Flavour and Form ‘Cream-Dot’ offers an intensely rich, buttery flavor with sweet, nutty undertones and a remarkably tender, almost melt-in-your-mouth texture. The meat is plump and pale beige, cooking to a creamy, soft consistency that distinguishes it from chewier clam varieties. The shells are thick and durable with pronounced concentric ridges, providing excellent protection while maintaining an attractive, classic bivalve appearance.

2. The Rich, Creamy Specialist This clam’s luxurious texture and deep flavor make it ideal for dishes where silkiness and rich taste are paramount.

  • Premium Clam Chowder: The premier use - creates an exceptionally velvety, rich chowder where its tender texture and buttery flavor become the star of the dish.
  • Clam Butter and Compound Butters: The meat blends beautifully into compound butters, creating a decadent spread for bread or finishing sauce for seafood.
  • Gentle Steaming and Poaching: Cooked gently in their own liquor or light broth to preserve their delicate texture, often served with simple drawn butter.
  • Pasta and Risotto: Melts into creamy sauces and risottos, imparting a rich, savory depth without overwhelming other ingredients.

3. The Harvest & Growth Cycle ‘Cream-Dot’ is a moderate-paced grower that develops its characteristic richness during the final weeks of maturation. They thrive in mixed sand-shell substrate with consistent, cool water flow. In a Haloponic™ substrate system, a square meter can yield 2-3 kg of premium butter clams over a 10-12 week cycle, reaching optimal richness and size of 5 cm in 9-11 weeks from juvenile seeding.
